docs.text: AIRR Knowledge Schema Common data model schema for the AIRR Knowledge Commons URI: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Name: ak-schema Classes Class Description AIRRKnowledgeCommons A container for instances of multiple classes. AKObject Anything uniquely identifiable in the AKC. NamedThing Name and description for AKC things. BCellReceptor None Cell None Chain None Conclusion None Dataset None Epitope None PeptidicEpitope None ImmuneExposure An event involving the immune system of a study participant. ImmuneSystem None LifeEvent An event in which a study participant participates. Model None CommunicativeModel None ConceptualModel None ModelingFramework None Participant A participant in an investigation. PlannedProcess A process to realize a plan. Assay None ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay None TCellReceptorEpitopeBindingAssay None Assessment None Investigation A scientific investigation. Simulation None SpecimenCollection None SpecimenProcessing None PlanSpecification A plan with specified actions to meet some objectives. ModelSpecification None Specimen None StudyArm A population of participants of an investigation. StudyEvent An event that is part of the study design of an investigation. TCellReceptor None AlphaBetaTCR None GammaDeltaTCR None Tissue None SimilarityCalculation None ChainSimilarity None ForeignObject An object held outside of the AK. Reference A document about an investigation. docs.title: AIRR Knowledge Schema

docs.text: Class Description AIRRKnowledgeCommons A container for instances of multiple classes. AKObject Anything uniquely identifiable in the AKC. NamedThing Name and description for AKC things. BCellReceptor None Cell None Chain None Conclusion None Dataset None Epitope None PeptidicEpitope None ImmuneExposure An event involving the immune system of a study participant. ImmuneSystem None LifeEvent An event in which a study participant participates. Model None CommunicativeModel None ConceptualModel None ModelingFramework None Participant A participant in an investigation. PlannedProcess A process to realize a plan. Assay None ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay None TCellReceptorEpitopeBindingAssay None Assessment None Investigation A scientific investigation. Simulation None SpecimenCollection None SpecimenProcessing None PlanSpecification A plan with specified actions to meet some objectives. ModelSpecification None Specimen None StudyArm A population of participants of an investigation. StudyEvent An event that is part of the study design of an investigation. TCellReceptor None AlphaBetaTCR None GammaDeltaTCR None Tissue None SimilarityCalculation None ChainSimilarity None ForeignObject An object held outside of the AK. Reference A document about an investigation. V1p4Alignment None V1p4AlleleDescription None V1p4Cell None V1p4CellProcessing None V1p4Clone None V1p4Contributor None V1p4ContributorContribution None V1p4DataProcessing None V1p4DeletedGene None V1p4Diagnosis None V1p4DocumentedAllele None V1p4Expression None V1p4Genotype None V1p4GenotypeSet None V1p4GermlineSet None V1p4MHCAllele None V1p4MHCGenotype None V1p4MHCGenotypeSet None V1p4Node None V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing None V1p4PCRTarget None V1p4PhysicalQuantity None V1p4Reactivity None V1p4RearrangedSequence None V1p4Rearrangement None V1p4Receptor None V1p4Repertoire None V1p4RepertoireGroup None V1p4Sample None V1p4SampleProcessing None V1p4SequenceDelineationV None V1p4SequencingData None V1p4SequencingRun None V1p4Study None V1p4Subject None V1p4SubjectGenotype None V1p4TimeInterval None V1p4TimePoint None V1p4TimeQuantity None V1p4Tree None V1p4UndocumentedAllele None V1p4UnrearrangedSequence None

true complete_sequences: name: complete_sequences description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: complete_sequences owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string physical_linkage: name: physical_linkage description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: physical_linkage owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - SpecimenCollection - SpecimenProcessing - Assay range: Specimen specimen_processing: name: specimen_processing description: A series of zero or more specimen processing steps that precede an assay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: BFO:0000051 alias: specimen_processing owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string multivalued: true complete_sequences: name: complete_sequences description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: complete_sequences owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string physical_linkage: name: physical_linkage description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: physical_linkage owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string specimen: name: specimen description: The specimen that was input for an assay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: OBI:0000293 alias: specimen owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - SpecimenCollection - SpecimenProcessing - Assay range: Specimen specimen_processing: name: specimen_processing description: A series of zero or more specimen processing steps that precede an assay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: BFO:0000051 alias: specimen_processing owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay range: SpecimenProcessing multivalued: true type: name: type from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 designates_type: true alias: type owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay - TCellReceptor - Epitope range: string assay_type: name: assay_type description: The specific type of an assay from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: rdf:type alias: assay_type owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay range: string target_entity_type: name: target_entity_type description: The type of the entity being measured from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: target_entity_type owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Assay - Assessment range: string name: name: name description: A human-readable name for a thing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: schema:name alias: name owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - NamedThing range: string description: name: description description: A human-readable description for a thing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 slot_uri: schema:description alias: description owner: ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay domain_of: - Typically, generated by the repository hosting the record. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__allele_description_id owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_description__allele_description_ref: name: allele_description__allele_description_ref annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique reference to the allele description, in standardized form (Repo:Label:Version) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__allele_description_ref owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: false allele_description__acknowledgements: name: allele_description__acknowledgements annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: List of individuals whose contribution to the gene description should be acknowledged. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The current maintainer should be listed first. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__acknowledgements owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: V1p4_Contributor required: true multivalued: true allele_description__release_version: name: allele_description__release_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Version number of this record, updated whenever a revised version is published or released from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__release_version owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: integer required: true allele_description__release_date: name: allele_description__release_date annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Date of this release from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__release_date owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_description__release_description: name: allele_description__release_description annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__release_description owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_description__label: name: allele_description__label annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The accepted name for this gene or allele following the relevant nomenclature. Typically, generated by the repository hosting the record. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__allele_description_id owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_description__allele_description_ref: name: allele_description__allele_description_ref annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique reference to the allele description, in standardized form (Repo:Label:Version) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__allele_description_ref owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: false allele_description__acknowledgements: name: allele_description__acknowledgements annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: List of individuals whose contribution to the gene description should be acknowledged. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The current maintainer should be listed first. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__acknowledgements owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: V1p4_Contributor required: true multivalued: true allele_description__release_version: name: allele_description__release_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Version number of this record, updated whenever a revised version is published or released from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__release_version owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: integer required: true allele_description__release_date: name: allele_description__release_date annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Date of this release from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__release_date owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_description__release_description: name: allele_description__release_description annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Brief descriptive notes of the reason for this release and the changes embodied from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: allele_description__release_description owner: V1p4_AlleleDescription domain_of: - V1p4_AlleleDescription range: string required: true allele_description__label: name: allele_description__label annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The accepted name for this gene or allele following the relevant nomenclature. https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target: name: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences: name: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_CompleteSequences required: true nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage: name: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalLinkage required: true

docs.text: name: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema attributes: nucleic_acid_processing__template_class: name: nucleic_acid_processing__template_class annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__template_class owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_TemplateClass required: true nucleic_acid_processing__template_quality: name: nucleic_acid_processing__template_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__template_quality owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__template_amount: name: nucleic_acid_processing__template_amount annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amount of template that went into the process from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__template_amount owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalQuantity required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_method: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_method annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Generic type of library generation from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_method owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_LibraryGenerationMethod required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target: name: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences: name: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_CompleteSequences required: true nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage: name: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage owner: V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalLinkage required: true

name: V1p4_Rearrangement from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema attributes: rearrangement__sequence_id: name: rearrangement__sequence_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique query sequence identifier for the Rearrangement. Most often this will be the input sequence header or a substring thereof, but may also be a custom identifier defined by the tool in cases where query sequences have been combined in some fashion prior to alignment. When downloaded from an AIRR Data Commons repository, this will usually be a universally unique record locator for linking with other objects in the AIRR Data Model. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__sequence: name: rearrangement__sequence annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The query nucleotide sequence. Usually, this is the unmodified input sequence, which may be reverse complemented if necessary. In some cases, this field may contain consensus sequences or other types of collapsed input sequences if these steps are performed prior to alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__quality: name: rearrangement__quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__quality owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__sequence_aa: name: rearrangement__sequence_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__rev_comp: name: rearrangement__rev_comp annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the alignment is on the opposite strand (reverse complemented) with respect to the query sequence. If True then all output data, such as alignment coordinates and sequences, are based on the reverse complement of 'sequence'. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__rev_comp owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangement__productive: name: rearrangement__productive annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__productive owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangement__vj_in_frame: name: rearrangement__vj_in_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__vj_in_frame owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangement__stop_codon: name: rearrangement__stop_codon annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__stop_codon owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangement__complete_vdj: name: rearrangement__complete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__complete_vdj owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangement__locus: name: rearrangement__locus annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Gene locus (chain type). Note that this field uses a controlled vocabulary that is meant to provide a generic classification of the locus, not necessarily the correct designation according to a specific nomenclature. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__locus owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: V1p4_Locus required: false rearrangement__locus_species: name: rearrangement__locus_species annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__locus_species owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: V1p4_LocusSpecies required: false rearrangement__v_call: name: rearrangement__v_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: V gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHV4-59*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__v_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__d_call: name: rearrangement__d_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: First or only D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__d_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__d2_call: name: rearrangement__d2_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Second D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__d2_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__j_call: name: rearrangement__j_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: J gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHJ4*02 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__j_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__c_call: name: rearrangement__c_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Constant region gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHG1*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__c_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__sequence_alignment: name: rearrangement__sequence_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Aligned portion of query sequence, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers, such as IMGT-gaps. Typically, this will include only the V(D)J region, but that is not a requirement. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence_alignment owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__quality_alignment: name: rearrangement__quality_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence_alignment quality. Order and length of reactivity_id and reactivity_ref are independent. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__reactivity_ref owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__repertoire_id: name: rearrangement__repertoire_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Identifier to the associated repertoire in study metadata. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__repertoire_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__sample_processing_id: name: rearrangement__sample_processing_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Identifier to the sample processing object in the repertoire metadata for this rearrangement. If the repertoire has multiple samples then this field may be empty or missing if the sample cannot be differentiated or the relationship is not maintained by the data processing. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sample_processing_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__data_processing_id: name: rearrangement__data_processing_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Identifier to the data processing object in the repertoire metadata for this rearrangement. docs.text: name: V1p4_Rearrangement from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema attributes: rearrangement__sequence_id: name: rearrangement__sequence_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Unique query sequence identifier for the Rearrangement. Most often this will be the input sequence header or a substring thereof, but may also be a custom identifier defined by the tool in cases where query sequences have been combined in some fashion prior to alignment. When downloaded from an AIRR Data Commons repository, this will usually be a universally unique record locator for linking with other objects in the AIRR Data Model. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence_id owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__sequence: name: rearrangement__sequence annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The query nucleotide sequence. Usually, this is the unmodified input sequence, which may be reverse complemented if necessary. In some cases, this field may contain consensus sequences or other types of collapsed input sequences if these steps are performed prior to alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__quality: name: rearrangement__quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: The Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__quality owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__sequence_aa: name: rearrangement__sequence_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__rev_comp: name: rearrangement__rev_comp annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the alignment is on the opposite strand (reverse complemented) with respect to the query sequence. If True then all output data, such as alignment coordinates and sequences, are based on the reverse complement of 'sequence'. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__rev_comp owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangement__productive: name: rearrangement__productive annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__productive owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: true rearrangement__vj_in_frame: name: rearrangement__vj_in_frame annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the V and J gene alignments are in-frame. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__vj_in_frame owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangement__stop_codon: name: rearrangement__stop_codon annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__stop_codon owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangement__complete_vdj: name: rearrangement__complete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__complete_vdj owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false rearrangement__locus: name: rearrangement__locus annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Gene locus (chain type). Note that this field uses a controlled vocabulary that is meant to provide a generic classification of the locus, not necessarily the correct designation according to a specific nomenclature. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__locus owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: V1p4_Locus required: false rearrangement__locus_species: name: rearrangement__locus_species annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__locus_species owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: V1p4_LocusSpecies required: false rearrangement__v_call: name: rearrangement__v_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: V gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHV4-59*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__v_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__d_call: name: rearrangement__d_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: First or only D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__d_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__d2_call: name: rearrangement__d2_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Second D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__d2_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__j_call: name: rearrangement__j_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: J gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHJ4*02 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__j_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__c_call: name: rearrangement__c_call annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Constant region gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHG1*01 if using IMGT/GENE-DB). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__c_call owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__sequence_alignment: name: rearrangement__sequence_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Aligned portion of query sequence, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers, such as IMGT-gaps. Typically, this will include only the V(D)J region, but that is not a requirement. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence_alignment owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__quality_alignment: name: rearrangement__quality_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Sanger/Phred quality scores for assessment of sequence_alignment quality. Phred quality scores from 0 to 93 are encoded using ASCII 33 to 126 (Used by Illumina from v1.8.) from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__quality_alignment owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__sequence_alignment_aa: name: rearrangement__sequence_alignment_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the aligned query sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__sequence_alignment_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__germline_alignment: name: rearrangement__germline_alignment annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Assembled, aligned, full-length inferred germline sequence spanning the same region as the sequence_alignment field (typically the V(D)J region) and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__germline_alignment owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: true rearrangement__germline_alignment_aa: name: rearrangement__germline_alignment_aa annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amino acid translation of the assembled germline sequence. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__germline_alignment_aa owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: string required: false rearrangement__junction: name: rearrangement__junction annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Junction region nucleotide sequence, where the junction is defined as the CDR3 plus the two flanking conserved codons. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__junction owner: V1p4_Rearrangement domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: integer required: true cell_processing__cells_per_reaction: name: cell_processing__cells_per_reaction annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of cells for each biological replicate from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processing__cells_per_reaction owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: integer required: true cell_processing__cell_storage: name: cell_processing__cell_storage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processing__cell_storage owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: boolean required: true cell_processing__cell_quality: name: cell_processing__cell_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processing__cell_quality owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true cell_processing__cell_isolation: name: cell_processing__cell_isolation annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processing__cell_isolation owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true cell_processing__cell_processing_protocol: name: cell_processing__cell_processing_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processing__cell_processing_protocol owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__template_class: name: nucleic_acid_processing__template_class annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__template_class owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_TemplateClass required: true nucleic_acid_processing__template_quality: name: nucleic_acid_processing__template_quality annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__template_quality owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__template_amount: name: nucleic_acid_processing__template_amount annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Amount of template that went into the process from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__template_amount owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalQuantity required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_method: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_method annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Generic type of library generation from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_method owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_LibraryGenerationMethod required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target: name: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences: name: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_CompleteSequences required: true nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage: name: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalLinkage required: true sequencing_run__sequencing_run_id: name: sequencing_run__sequencing_run_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__sequencing_run_id owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_SequencingRun - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true sequencing_run__total_reads_passing_qc_filter: name: sequencing_run__total_reads_passing_qc_filter annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Number of usable reads for analysis from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__total_reads_passing_qc_filter owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_SequencingRun - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: integer required: true sequencing_run__sequencing_platform: name: sequencing_run__sequencing_platform annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Designation of sequencing instrument used from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__sequencing_platform owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_SequencingRun - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true sequencing_run__sequencing_facility: name: sequencing_run__sequencing_facility annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Name and address of sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__sequencing_facility owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_SequencingRun - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true sequencing_run__sequencing_run_date: name: sequencing_run__sequencing_run_date annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Date of sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__sequencing_run_date owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_SequencingRun - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true sequencing_run__sequencing_kit: name: sequencing_run__sequencing_kit annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__sequencing_kit owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_SequencingRun - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true sequencing_run__sequencing_files: name: sequencing_run__sequencing_files annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: Set of sequencing files produced by the sequencing run from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__sequencing_files owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_SequencingRun - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_SequencingData required: false

If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processing__cell_species owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_LibraryGenerationMethod required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_protocol owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version: name: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__library_generation_kit_version owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: string required: true nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target: name: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences: name: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_CompleteSequences required: true nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage: name: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalLinkage required: true sequencing_run__sequencing_run_id: name: sequencing_run__sequencing_run_id annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: sequencing_run__sequencing_run_id owner: V1p4_SampleProcessing domain_of: - docs.text: Slot: allele_description__acknowledgements List of individuals whose contribution to the gene description should be acknowledged. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The current maintainer should be listed first. docs.text: Slot: allele_description__j_codon_frame Codon position of the first nucleotide in the 'coding_sequence' field. Mandatory for J genes. Not used for V or D genes. '1' means the sequence is in-frame, '2' means that the first bp is missing from the first codon, and '3' means that the first 2 bp are missing. docs.text: Slot: cell_processing__cell_species Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to species , in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the species information for all lower layers of the schema. Typically, this value should be identical to `species`, in which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g., chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `species` information for all lower layers of the schema. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: cell_processing__cell_species domain_of: - V1p4_CellProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_CellSpecies required: false

docs.text: Slot: clone__clone_count Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization. URI: ak_schema:clone__clone_count Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Clone no Properties Range: Integer Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:clone__clone_count native ak_schema:clone__clone_count LinkML Source name: clone__clone_count annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: Absolute count of the size (number of members) of this clone in the repertoire. This could simply be the number of sequences (Rearrangement records) observed in this clone, the number of distinct cell barcodes (unique cell_id values), or a more sophisticated calculation appropriate to the experimental protocol. Absolute count is provided versus a frequency so that downstream analysis tools can perform their own normalization. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: clone__clone_count domain_of: - V1p4_Clone range: integer required: false

docs.text: Slot: complete_sequences To be considered complete , the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered complete & untemplated , the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. mixed should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. URI: ak_schema:complete_sequences Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay no Properties Range: String Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:complete_sequences native ak_schema:complete_sequences LinkML Source name: complete_sequences description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: complete_sequences domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string
docs.title: Slot: complete_sequences

To be considered complete & untemplated , the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. mixed should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. docs.text: Slot: germline_set__acknowledgements List of individuals whose contribution to the germline set should be acknowledged. Note that these are not necessarily identical with the authors on an associated manuscript or other scholarly communication. Further note that typically at least the three CRediT contributor roles "supervision", "investigation" and "data curation" should be assigned. The coresponding author should be listed last. docs.text: Slot: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences To be considered complete , the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered complete & untemplated , the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. mixed should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. URI: ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing no V1p4SampleProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4CompleteSequences Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable False Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences native ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences LinkML Source name: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation. `mixed` should only be used if the procedure used for library construction will likely produce multiple categories of sequences in the given experiment. It SHOULD NOT be used as a replacement of a NULL value. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_CompleteSequences required: true
docs.title: Slot: nucleic_acid_processing__complete_sequences

docs.text: Slot: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target If a PCR step was performed that specifically targets the IG/TR loci, the target and primer locations need to be provided here. This field holds an array of PCRTarget objects, so that multiplex PCR setups amplifying multiple loci at the same time can be annotated using one record per locus. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. PCR setups not targeting any specific locus must not annotate this field but select the appropriate library_generation_method instead. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__pcr_target domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PCRTarget required: false multivalued: true
docs.title: LinkML Source

docs.text: Slot: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct Rearrangements before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All hetero_* terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. *_head-head refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. *_tail-head refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. *_prelinked refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). URI: ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4NucleicAcidProcessing no V1p4SampleProcessing no Properties Range: V1p4PhysicalLinkage Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable False Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage native ak_schema:nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage LinkML Source name: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: false description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: nucleic_acid_processing__physical_linkage domain_of: - V1p4_NucleicAcidProcessing - V1p4_SampleProcessing range: V1p4_PhysicalLinkage required: true

docs.text: Slot: physical_linkage In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct Rearrangements before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All hetero_* terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. *_head-head refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. *_tail-head refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. *_prelinked refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). URI: ak_schema:physical_linkage Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay no Properties Range: String Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:physical_linkage native ak_schema:physical_linkage LinkML Source name: physical_linkage description: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct `Rearrangements` before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All `hetero_*` terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. `*_head-head` refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. `*_tail-head` refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. `*_prelinked` refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: physical_linkage domain_of: - ReceptorRepertoireSequencingAssay range: string
docs.title: Slot: physical_linkage

docs.text: In case an experimental setup is used that physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct Rearrangements before library preparation, this field describes the mode of that linkage. All hetero_* terms indicate that in case of paired-read sequencing, the two reads should be expected to map to distinct IG/TR loci. *_head-head refers to techniques that link the 5' ends of transcripts in a single-cell context. *_tail-head refers to techniques that link the 3' end of one transcript to the 5' end of another one in a single-cell context. This term does not provide any information whether a continuous reading-frame between the two is generated. *_prelinked refers to constructs in which the linkage was already present on the DNA level (e.g. scFv). URI: ak_schema:physical_linkage

docs.text: Slot: reactivity__reactivity_method The methodology used to assess/classify reactivity. This should be either the assay utlizied in the experiment, delineated as "annotated" if annotated from an external source (e.g. IEDB), or inferred if imputed using a computational method. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: native_protein, MHC_peptide_multimer, annotated, inferred. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: native_protein, MHC_peptide_multimer, annotated, inferred.' from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: reactivity__reactivity_method domain_of: - V1p4_Reactivity range: string required: true

docs.text: Slot: reactivity__reactivity_readout Reactivity measurement read-out. For physical assays, this should describe what was measured. For inferred and annotated methods this should indicate a confidence/quality level for the inference/annotation. In future versions we anticipate this field being an enumerated type, and it is strongly recommended that users utilize one of the following keywords in this field if appropriate: fluorescence_intensity, barcode_count, confidence. docs.text: Slot: rearrangement__complete_vdj True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. URI: ak_schema:rearrangement__complete_vdj Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot V1p4Rearrangement no Properties Range: Boolean Identifier and Mapping Information Annotations property value nullable True Schema Source from schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self ak_schema:rearrangement__complete_vdj native ak_schema:rearrangement__complete_vdj LinkML Source name: rearrangement__complete_vdj annotations: nullable: tag: nullable value: true description: True if the sequence alignment spans the entire V(D)J region. Meaning, sequence_alignment includes both the first V gene codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e., after the leader sequence) and the last complete codon of the J gene (i.e., before the J-C splice site). This does not require an absence of deletions within the internal FWR and CDR regions of the alignment. from_schema: https://github.com/airr-knowledge/ak-schema rank: 1000 alias: rearrangement__complete_vdj domain_of: - V1p4_Rearrangement range: boolean required: false

docs.text: Slot: rearrangement__locus_species Binomial designation of the species from which the locus originates. Typically, this value should be identical to organism , if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. However, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. transgenic animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the organism information for all lower layers of the schema. docs.text: Slot: rearrangement__sequence_id Unique query sequence identifier for the Rearrangement. Most often this will be the input sequence header or a substring thereof, but may also be a custom identifier defined by the tool in cases where query sequences have been combined in some fashion prior to alignment. When downloaded from an AIRR Data Commons repository, this will usually be a universally unique record locator for linking with other objects in the AIRR Data Model. docs.text: Slot: repertoire__repertoire_id Identifier for the repertoire object. This identifier should be globally unique so that repertoires from multiple studies can be combined together without conflict. The repertoire_id is used to link other AIRR data to a Repertoire. Specifically, the Rearrangements Schema includes repertoire_id for referencing the specific Repertoire for that Rearrangement. docs.text: Slot: study__contributors List of individuals who contributed to the study. docs.text: Slot: study__keywords_study Keywords describing properties of one or more data sets in a study. "contains_schema" keywords indicate that the study contains data objects from the AIRR Schema of that type (Rearrangement, Clone, Cell, Receptor) while the other keywords indicate that the study design considers the type of data indicated (e.g. it is possible to have a study that "contains_paired_chain" but does not "contains_schema_cell"). docs.text: Slot: subject__age_event Event in the study schedule to which Age refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be sampling . For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between Age event and Sample collection time , hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity.
